data.title: ArchiveGrid : James E. Murray Papers 1918

data.meta_description: ArchiveGrid connects you with archives around the world to find historical documents, personal papers, family histories, and more.
data.text:
Details

483 linear ft

Arranged in five series: I. General Correspondence, 1934-1960. II. Legislation, 1934-1960. III. Speeches and Writings, 1934-1960. IV. Clippings, 1936-1961. V. Film, 1953 and undated (not yet fully described)

The senatorial papers of James E. Murray from 1934 until his retirement from office in 1960 -- The bulk of the collection consists of general correspondence (412.5 linear ft). The legislation files are subdivided by congressional session and contain Senate bills and resolutions sponsored by Murray. The bulk of the speeches and writings consists of press releases, radio addresses (including those made to his constituents back in Montana from Washington), and public addresses. Topics reflect Murray's interest in numerous issues, including agriculture, foreign affairs, immigration, labor, the military, mining, the proposed Missouri Valley Authority, Native Americans, public power, public works, small business, veterans, and World War II

U.S. senator from Montana; full name: James Edward Murray; b. 1876; d. 1961

This record replaces NUCMC entry MS 78-1961

Finding aid in the repository
